name: Fractured Brand Names Online Quiz | Fractured Words | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Kleenex.

	Kleenex brand facial tissues were invented in 1924. Kleenex invented the 'pop-up' box, too. Colored tissues came out a few years after white ones appeared.

Rice a Roni & Rice-a-Roni.

	The San Francisco treat!

Pepto Bismol & Pepto-Bismol.

	It's thick, it's chalky, it's VERY pink, it's Pepto Bismol!

Rice Krispies.

	Snap, crackle, pop! My friend Charles McElmurry, a cartoonist, was one of the original creators of the Snap, Crackle, and Pop characters (little elf-type guys with boats and planes and such).

Jello & Jell-o.

	I like the blue kind. I make it in one of those 1950s Pyrex bowls--the green one with white inside. Looks pretty with the blue Jello.

Nestle's Quik&nestles quik&nesquick&nestle quick.

	I used to love the chocolate kind. I know they make strawberry, too, and banana? It's called Nesquik now.

Oreos & Oreo.

	Did you used to open 'em up and scrape out the frosting with your teeth? I did.

Quaker oats.

	My nephew likes the instant brand that turns blue when you pour in boiling water. It has little candy sharks in it, I think.

Pampers.

	Then there are Pull-ups for bigger kids. Have you heard of Bibsters? My boyfriend and I made up a funny but rude name for disposable diapers. It means poopsters but it starts with cr.

questions.text: This is a hard one. You may not be aware of this product. Caw ten ills
questions.explanation:
Cottonelles & Cottonelle.

	The less said the better. My friend and I thought it would be funny if someone named their daughter Cottonelle: 'Cottonelle! You get in this house!'
